speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: SCENE III. Tarsus. A room in CLEON's house.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Enter PERICLES, CLEON, DIONYZA, and LYCHORIDA with MARINA in her arms

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Most honour'd Cleon, I must needs be gone;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: My twelve months are expired, and Tyrus stands

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: In a litigious peace. You, and your lady,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Take from my heart all thankfulness! The gods

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Make up the rest upon you!

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: Your shafts of fortune, though they hurt you mortally,

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: Yet glance full wanderingly on us.

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: O your sweet queen!

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: That the strict fates had pleased you had brought her hither,

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: To have bless'd mine eyes with her!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: We cannot but obey

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: The powers above us. Could I rage and roar

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: As doth the sea she lies in, yet the end

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Must be as 'tis. My gentle babe Marina, whom,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: For she was born at sea, I have named so, here

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I charge your charity withal, leaving her

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: The infant of your care; beseeching you

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To give her princely training, that she may be

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Manner'd as she is born.

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: Fear not, my lord, but think

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: Your grace, that fed my country with your corn,

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: For which the people's prayers still fall upon you,

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: Must in your child be thought on. If neglection

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: Should therein make me vile, the common body,

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: By you relieved, would force me to my duty:

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: But if to that my nature need a spur,

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: The gods revenge it upon me and mine,

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: To the end of generation!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I believe you;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Your honour and your goodness teach me to't,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Without your vows. Till she be married, madam,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: By bright Diana, whom we honour, all

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Unscissor'd shall this hair of mine remain,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Though I show ill in't. So I take my leave.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Good madam, make me blessed in your care

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: In bringing up my child.

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: I have one myself,

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Who shall not be more dear to my respect

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Than yours, my lord.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Madam, my thanks and prayers.

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: We'll bring your grace e'en to the edge o' the shore,

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: Then give you up to the mask'd Neptune and

speaker: CLEON
text_entry: The gentlest winds of heaven.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I will embrace

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Your offer. Come, dearest madam. O, no tears,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Lychorida, no tears:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Look to your little mistress, on whose grace

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: You may depend hereafter. Come, my lord.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Exeunt
